terminologie_extrait.contexte: used to describe a serve that is spinny and goes short

serving_short_with_spin.probleme: Should you serve with lots of spin or sacrifice spin to keep the serve short?

debutant.description: focus on keeping the ball low with as much backspin as possible while still keeping the ball short

intermediaire.nom: spinny serve with low contact point
intermediaire.description: learn to serve the ball low with a low contact point and varying depths

exercices_complementaires.nom: whipping the racket into the ball at full speed
exercices_complementaires.description: to get maximum spin, whip the racket into the ball at full speed but barely graze the ball

metriques_progression.description: ideal spin serve will bounce twice on the opponent's side of the table, with the second bounce as close to the endline as possible

erreurs_a_eviter.nom: serving just backspin or no-spin when you want to serve short
erreurs_a_eviter.description: this greatly limits your options and makes things a lot easier for the opponent
